HEADLINE: Here Are 6 Ways to Know It‚Äôs Time to Sell Your Crypto
SUMMARY: Investing in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies can be extremely rewarding, but it‚Äôs also very risky. Knowing when to sell is just as critical as knowing when to buy. That‚Äôs because selling too early can mean missing out on potentially life-changing gains, while selling too late can lead to devastating losses. Timing the market is very challenging, but there are clear signs that can undoubtedly help you out. In this article, we take a look at six key signs that it might be time to sell your crypto (or at least some of it). You Need the Money This is the most practical reason to sell your cryptocurrency. If you need money for a major expense that cannot tolerate any delays, such as a medical bill, selling some (or all, if needed) of your cryptocurrency can be a smart move. Investments are not just about growing wealth. They are supposed to support your life and make it better. Crypto markets are highly volatile, and holding on during a prolonged downturn while needing funds on hand can put you in a tough situation. Remember, nothing is more important than your health ‚Äì if selling helps you meet an urgent bill, it may be the right choice, regardless of what the charts are saying right now. You Have Hit Your Target Price One of the most basic but effective strategies is to simply set a target price before you buy. Now, this could be a specific dollar amount or a percentage gain. For example, you may want to sell once your investment doubles, or when BTC‚Äôs price hits $1 million. Sticking to your plan helps remove emotion from the decision. Many investors get greedy when the prices start to increase drastically and hold on for too long. This often leads to sharp corrections that simply wipe out your gains. Setting a target also helps you lock in profits and reduce exposure. Also, keep in mind that you don‚Äôt have to sell everything at once ‚Äì selling part of your position when you reach your goal can be a very balanced approach. The Fundamentals Have Changed Every single cryptocurrency is tied to a set of assumptions. These can include various things ‚Äì from the strength of the development team, user growth, regulatory clarity, overall merits, and many more. When those assumptions change ‚Äì it‚Äôs time to reassess. For instance, if a project starts delaying its roadmap, fails to deliver promised upgrades, starts losing key developers or team members that were part of your original investment thesis ‚Äì your reasoning might no longer apply. Another interesting scenario is competition ‚Äì if a new project enters the space that offers a better version of the same product, your investment thesis might weaken. In cases like these, holding on based on past performance could be a mistake. It might be better to exit and look for better and stronger opportunities. Market Sentiment Turns EXTREMELY Bullish At a glance, this might sound quite counterintuitive, but extreme optimism can oftentimes be a warning sign. When everyone is talking about buying, and prices are increasing fast, this could signal a market top. During crypto bull runs, prices often move beyond what the project‚Äôs fundamentals support. Valuations tend to become incredibly inflated. In many cases, this is followed by very sharp corrections. You can track sentiment indicators such as Google Trends, social media chatter, fear-and-greed indexes, and others ‚Äì all of it can help. If hype reaches levels that you think are unsustainable ‚Äì it may be time to take some profits off the table. You Are Overexposed to One Asset Diversification is a basic risk management rule. If one of your crypto positions grows to become a very large part of your portfolio, your overall risk increases. For instance, if one of your altcoins that you bought early on has taken off and now makes up 60% of your holdings, a sudden drop in that coin could impact your whole portfolio. Rebalancing is a very common strategy. This means selling part of the overgrown position and reinvesting the proceeds into other assets or holding it in cash. It helps keep your portfolio aligned with your risk tolerance. I understand that sometimes this may feel like giving up gains, but it‚Äôs a long-term strategy to reduce volatility and avoid major losses. You are No Longer Comfortable With the Risk The crypto market is not for everyone. It is quite common for people to enter during bull markets when euphoria is high and prices move fast. But when the volatility goes the other way, many realize that they can‚Äôt handle the stress. If price swings keep you up at night or cause emotional stress, you may be overexposed. Selling some or all of your holdings can help reduce anxiety, which may also translate into overall improvement of your financial well-being. Investing should be based on your risk tolerance, not just the potential rewards. There is nothing wrong with stepping back if the risk is no longer acceptable for you. It‚Äôs better to invest in line with what your comfort level is rather than to force yourself to stay i

I understand that sometimes this may feel like giving up gains, but it‚Äôs a long-term strategy to reduce volatility and avoid major losses. You are No Longer Comfortable With the Risk The crypto market is not for everyone. It is quite common for people to enter during bull markets when euphoria is high and prices move fast. But when the volatility goes the other way, many realize that they can‚Äôt handle the stress. If price swings keep you up at night or cause emotional stress, you may be overexposed. Selling some or all of your holdings can help reduce anxiety, which may also translate into overall improvement of your financial well-being. Investing should be based on your risk tolerance, not just the potential rewards. There is nothing wrong with stepping back if the risk is no longer acceptable for you. It‚Äôs better to invest in line with what your comfort level is rather than to force yourself to stay i

HEADLINE: Bitcoin wallet worth $468 M awakens after 14.5 years; The original investment will shock you
SUMMARY: A Bitcoin ( BTC ) wallet containing 3,962 BTC has been activated after 14.5 years of dormancy, according to blockchain monitoring service Whale Alert. üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ üí§ A dormant address containing 3,962 #BTC (468,046,931 USD) has just been activated after 14.5 years! https://t.co/LXdjguOqYv ‚Äî Whale Alert (@whale_alert) July 24, 2025 The 3,962 BTC would have been worth approximately $1,189 when purchased 14.5 years ago at $0.30 per coin in January 2011, meaning the holdings have gained over $467 million in value, representing a 39,450,523% increase. While the wallet‚Äôs owner remains unidentified, transactions of this size and vintage often spark speculation around early Bitcoin adopters and miners from the cryptocurrency‚Äôs first years. Similar movements have been observed throughout 2025, including a Satoshi -era wallet that moved $4.68 billion in Bitcoin after 14 years and another address that transferred $1 billion worth of BTC after remaining dormant since April 2011. Importantly, while the wallet has been activated, there is no indication yet that the Bitcoin has been moved to an exchange . Bitcoin price analysis At press time, Bitcoin is trading at $118,040, down 1.97% in the last 7 days. The cryptocurrency reached an all-time high of $120,551 last week and has remained relatively close to these peak levels since then. BTC 7-day price chart. Source: Finbold According to crypto analyst Crypto Patel, over 1.48 million BTC changed hands in the last 30 days. Most selling happened below $105K, while new buyers are stepping in between $105K and $120K. A new support zone appears to be forming around $117K-$118K. If the market pulls back, this area could hold, suggesting continued strength in Bitcoin‚Äôs price structure. Bitcoin‚Äôs strong rally has led traders to secure profits, triggering a sudden crypto market decline as profit-taking accelerated across the broader cryptocurrency ecosystem. In fact, in the last 24 hours, over 314,000 traders were liquidated, wiping out $968 million , mostly from long trades. Featured image via Shutterstock. The post Bitcoin wallet worth $468 M awakens after 14.5 years; The original investment will shock you appeared first on Finbold .

HEADLINE: Unveiling the Mystery: A Gigantic Bitcoin Whale Transfer Shakes the Market
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Unveiling the Mystery: A Gigantic Bitcoin Whale Transfer Shakes the Market In the often-unpredictable world of cryptocurrency, certain events stand out, capturing the attention of investors, analysts, and enthusiasts alike. One such seismic event recently occurred: a colossal Bitcoin whale transfer . Imagine nearly half a billion dollars in Bitcoin, previously dormant for years, suddenly stirring and moving to a new digital address. This isn‚Äôt just a transaction; it‚Äôs a profound signal that sends ripples across the entire crypto ecosystem. What does such a massive Bitcoin whale transfer signify, and why should you care? The Awakening: What Exactly Happened in This Gigantic Bitcoin Whale Transfer? The crypto community was abuzz when news broke of a long-inactive Bitcoin (BTC) whale making an extraordinary move. According to Onchain Lens on X , an entity holding a staggering 3,962.62 BTC, valued at approximately $468.67 million at the time of the transfer, shifted its entire holdings to a brand-new wallet. This monumental Bitcoin whale transfer wasn‚Äôt impulsive; it was preceded by a small, almost imperceptible test transaction, a common practice among large holders to ensure the main transfer goes smoothly. To put this into perspective, a ‚Äúwhale‚Äù in crypto terms refers to an individual or entity holding a significant amount of a particular cryptocurrency, enough to potentially influence market prices with their trades. A ‚Äúdormant‚Äù whale is one whose holdings have remained untouched for an extended period, often years. The sudden activation of such a large, previously inactive wallet is rare and always triggers intense speculation. This specific Bitcoin whale transfer represents one of the largest movements from a long-term dormant address in recent memory. Why Does a Bitcoin Whale Transfer of This Magnitude Matter? The movement of hundreds of millions of dollars by a single entity is never a trivial matter, especially in a relatively nascent market like cryptocurrency. A significant Bitcoin whale transfer can have multiple implications, affecting everything from market sentiment to liquidity. Here‚Äôs why this event is so closely watched: Market Psychology: The crypto market is heavily influenced by sentiment. A large transfer from a dormant whale can be interpreted in various ways ‚Äì as a precursor to selling, a repositioning for long-term holding, or even a security measure. These interpretations can sway market participants‚Äô decisions, leading to either fear or optimism. Liquidity Dynamics: While the transfer itself doesn‚Äôt directly impact price, the possibility of these funds entering exchanges for sale could significantly increase selling pressure, potentially leading to a price drop. Conversely, if the funds are moved to a cold storage wallet, it might signal an intent to hold, reducing immediate supply. On-Chain Transparency: Unlike traditional finance, blockchain technology offers unparalleled transparency. Every Bitcoin whale transfer is recorded on the public ledger, allowing analysts to track movements and infer potential intentions, even if the identity of the whale remains anonymous. This transparency provides valuable insights into the behavior of large market players. Unpacking the Mystery: Who Could Be Behind This Bitcoin Whale Transfer? The identity of this specific whale remains shrouded in mystery, as is often the case with large crypto holdings. However, speculation runs rampant, with several theories emerging about who might be behind such a substantial Bitcoin whale transfer : Early Adopter or ‚ÄúSatoshi Era‚Äù Holder: Many believe these long-dormant wallets belong to early Bitcoin miners or investors who acquired BTC when it was worth mere pennies. The activation could mean they are finally moving their assets for various reasons, perhaps to secure them better or prepare for a future event. While unlikely to be Satoshi Nakamoto themselves (whose known wallets remain untouched), it could be someone from that formative period. Institutional Investor or Fund: As institutional adoption of Bitcoin grows, it‚Äôs plausible that a large fund or corporation that acquired BTC years ago is simply reorganizing its assets or transferring them to a new custodian for improved security or operational efficiency. Exchange or Custodian: Sometimes, these transfers are internal movements by exchanges or custodial services managing large amounts of client funds. They might be consolidating wallets, upgrading security protocols, or preparing for large withdrawals/deposits. ‚ÄúLost and Found‚Äù Wallets: In rare cases, individuals who lost access to their early Bitcoin holdings due to forgotten passwords, corrupted drives, or misplaced hardware wallets manage to regain access. This could represent a monumental personal discovery for the whale in question. Without direct confirmation, these remain educated guesses. The beauty and challenge of blockchain lie in its pseudonymity, where actions are public but iden

HEADLINE: Fact Check: Did BlackRock Announce a Merger With Ripple?
SUMMARY: The post Fact Check: Did BlackRock Announce a Merger With Ripple? appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News XRP is now larger than some of the biggest companies in the world, in the meantime, while XRP is making waves in the crypto domain a news viral news is circulating in the XRP Community that BlackRock will merge with Ripple, suggesting these two financial giants are about to combine forces. But how much truth is there behind this viral claim? Where Did This Claim Originate? The speculation started when Atlas , a known crypto and on-chain analyst on X, posted a thread noting that BlackRock and Ripple ‚Äúwill merge,‚Äù describing it as a natural alignment between both companies‚Äô goals, structures, and financial strategies. Atlas claimed to have reviewed ‚Äúleaked documents‚Äù showing overlaps and shared objectives. But, is there any proof or source proving this claim? Fact Check: What Do the Facts Show? No Official Announcement or Confirmation As of now, there is no official announcement from BlackRock or Ripple regarding a merger, partnership, or acquisition. Neither company has issued a press release or statement supporting the rumor. Leading crypto news outlets and mainstream business media have also not reported any deal between the two firms. No Proof for Leak Document However, Atlas claimed he looked at leaked documents, but he did not share any source in his tweet. While some theories suggest Ripple and BlackRock could be working on similar systems or share the same goals, these ideas remain speculative and are not confirmed facts. Strategic Hiring, Not a Merger Recent developments show Ripple hiring executives with backgrounds in major financial institutions, including BlackRock. While, hiring executives and aligning strategies do not amount to a corporate merger. BlackRock Will Go For XRP ETF Soon Ripple has dropped its cross-appeal , and many expect the SEC to do the same soon. Ripple‚Äôs CEO, Brad Garlinghouse, hinted that now, just like Bitcoin and Ethereum, XRP has a clear path for an ETF. Before this, legal troubles were the biggest block for an XRP ETF in the US. With that out of the way, experts like Nate Geraci say BlackRock could be next to file. Garlinghouse didn‚Äôt say there‚Äôs an official deal with BlackRock yet, but the door is open. Key Evidence Table: Coinpedia‚Äôs Fact Check Claim Coinpedia‚Äôs Evidence BlackRock will merge with Ripple No official news, only social media speculation Leaked documents ‚Äúreveal‚Äù alignment No verified sources or documents published Recent executive changes hint merger Hires from BlackRock, but no sign of merger talks BlackRock confirmed to file for XRP ETF No filing yet, but the firm is now able to consider it openly Conclusion Claim BlackRock will merge with Ripple. Verdict False Fact-Check by Coinpedia There is no official evidence or confirmation supporting claims that BlackRock and Ripple are merging. The rumor is based on unverified tweets and ongoing community speculation. While both companies are actively involved in financial innovation, all available facts show no current plan or move toward a merger. .article_register_shortcode { padding: 18px 24px; border-radius: 8px; display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 6px 0 22px; border: 1px solid #0052CC4D; background: linear-gradient(90deg, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1) 0%, rgba(0, 82, 204, 0.1) 100%); } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { color: #000000; font-weight: 600; font-size: 20px; line-height: 22px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 span { color: #0052CC; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px; line-height: 22px; color: #171717B2; margin-top: 4px; text-align:left; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body{ padding-right: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: right; } .article_register_shortcode .primary-button img{ vertical-align: middle; width: 20px; margin: 0; display: inline-block; } @media (min-width: 581px) and (max-width: 991px) { .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { margin-bottom: 0; } } @media (max-width: 580px) { .article_register_shortcode { display: block; padding: 20px; } .article_register_shortcode img { max-width: 50px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body h5 { font-size: 16px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body { margin-left: 0px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-body p { font-size: 13px; line-height: 20px; margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 14px; } .article_register_shortcode .media-button a { float: unset; } .article_register_shortcode .secondary-button { margin-bottom: 0; } } Never Miss a Beat in the Crypto World! HEADLINE: XRP Price Forms Double Top, This Structure Says A Crash Is Coming
SUMMARY: The XRP price seems to be in a slowdown after a sharp rally that put it just shy of its $3.8 all-time high . Despite the bullish developments that have emerged for Ripple and XRP over the last few months, its inability to reach new highs has suggested the altcoin might not have as much strength needed to continue. Now, another bearish development has piled on as crypto analyst Tradersboat has pointed out the formation of a double top on the chart. XRP Price Double Top Says Rally Could Be Over In the analysis, Tradersboat pointed out that the XRP price has already hit a double top, which often marks the end of a rally. This comes as the altcoin has been tapping into external liquidity, and there has been an exhaustion on the buyer side. The result is the double-top above the $3.6 but still below its $3.8 peak. Naturally, a double top shows that the end is in sight and the result is usually a price crash, something the analyst alludes to. However, the chart does show that there is the possibility of one more uptrend . This is the upward sweep that will help to grab liquidity from above the $3.7 level before the trend plays out completely. In addition to the double top formation, the crypto analyst also explains that there has been a Break of Structure (BOS). Historically, Break of Structures shows that bears are beginning to take charge, adding to the already bearish intent of the double top. Both these things point to one possible end game, and that is a price crash. The XRP price had already swept the highs above to trigger the resistance at $3.6, indicated by the rejection from this level . So, a clean break was not achieved here. Given this, the analyst expects that there will be a sell-off back toward the sell-side liquidity zone, and this happens to lie below $3.4, with a possibility of further breakdown. Closing In The Green For July So far, the month of July has been quite bullish for the XRP price , pushing over 55% gains already for the month, CryptoRank shows . This is in line with the 5-year streak that has been maintained as XRP has closed each July of the last five years in the green, and 2025 is proving to be no different. However, if the altcoin does stay true to trend, then there is a possibility that the price does crash in the month of August. With an average crash of over 12% in the last three years, the analyst‚Äôs prediction could likely play out in the month of August, which remains one of the most bearish months for the XRP price .

HEADLINE: The US Is A Bitcoin Whale‚ÄîArkham Clarifies BTC Holdings After Brief Panic
SUMMARY: According to Arkham Intelligence, the US government still holds more than 198,000‚ÄØBitcoin. That‚Äôs around $23.4 billion sitting in digital wallets across several agencies. Related Reading: PEPE Sparks Google Frenzy With 300% Surge In Search Interest A recent public spreadsheet showed just 28,988.356 BTC under the Marshals Service. But looking at FBI, IRS, DEA and Justice Department seizures makes the total jump far higher. Government Stash Spread Across Agencies Based on reports from the Marshals Service, 28,988.356 BTC‚Äîworth roughly $3.45 billion‚Äîhas been under its control since July‚ÄØ15, 2025. Other agencies don‚Äôt share that data publicly. They manage coins from crime probes and prize auctions. Arkham gathered on‚Äëchain data and linked addresses tied to each agency. When added, the total hits at least 198,012 BTC. DID THE US GOVERNMENT JUST SELL 170,000 BTC ($20 BILLION)? No. This Freedom of Information Request response from the US Marshals Service (USMS) cites them as holding 28,988 BTC ($3.4B), but other departments of the US Government also seize and hold Bitcoin, including the FBI,‚Ä¶ https://t.co/8kpjwyKcT9 pic.twitter.com/uB7EejUCVz ‚Äî Arkham (@arkham) July 23, 2025 In everyday terms, that means the US is a massive bitcoin ‚Äúwhale‚Äù that still owns about 198,000 BTC. It‚Äôs not just sitting at the Marshals Service. The rest is spread out in hidden pockets. Those coins haven‚Äôt moved in the last four months. Traders who saw only the Marshals number panicked. Senator Cynthia Lummis even warned it would be a ‚Äútotal strategic blunder‚Äù if the reserves really fell below 30,000 BTC. Arkham: The US Government currently holds at least 198,000 BTC ($23.5B) across multiple addresses held by different government arms. None of this has moved for 4 months. pic.twitter.com/nhWWeWqhmh ‚Äî Wu Blockchain (@WuBlockchain) July 24, 2025 Big Cases Make Up Most Holdings A huge chunk‚Äî114,599 BTC‚Äîcame from the 2016 Bitfinex hack case against Ilya Lichtenstein and Heather Morgan. That haul alone counts for more than $13.65 billion. Silk Road‚Äërelated seizures add about 94,643 BTC. That breaks down into 51,680 BTC from James Zhong‚Äôs theft and 69,370 BTC linked to another hacker, sometimes called ‚ÄúIndividual‚ÄØX.‚Äù Other cases help pad the total. Arkham spotted $81.25 million in BTC taken from Alameda Research‚Äôs Binance accounts after FTX collapsed. Another $79.50 million came from HashFlare scammers Sergei Potapenko and Ivan Turogin. Even small hits like 58.7 BTC from Ryan Farace‚Äôs case show up in the chain records. Sales Haven‚Äôt Touched Core Supply The US sold 9,861‚ÄØBTC worth about $215 million in March‚ÄØ2023 from the Zhong case. In August 2024, another 10,000 BTC went for $594 million. Then in December 2024, 10,000 BTC sold for roughly $968 million. Despite that activity, the main piles from Bitfinex and Silk Road haven‚Äôt moved. Those coins still sit where seizing agencies left them. Related Reading: BREAKING ‚Äì US Set To Reveal Key Crypto Report‚ÄîA Make‚ÄëOr‚ÄëBreak Moment For Bitcoin Without a single public ledger, each new FOIA release sparks fresh rumors. Some traders jumped at the Marshals figure and drove prices up or down on the news. But knowing the real 198,000 BTC figure could calm that. A master dashboard, updated in near real time, would help cut the drama when auctions roll around. Featured image from Getty Images, chart from TradingView

HEADLINE: Arkham Answers the Question Everyone''s Wondering: "Did the US Government Secretly Sell Bitcoin?" ‚Äì Reveals How Much BTC the US Holds!
SUMMARY: US President Donald Trump established a US national strategic Bitcoin reserve with an executive order signed in March. At this point, Trump stated that the US government would not sell the BTCs it held, but would look for ways to purchase new BTCs. While nearly four months have passed since the executive order establishing the Bitcoin reserve, Arkham said that the US government''s BTC holdings have not changed for four months. According to Arkham data, the US government has not moved its Bitcoin holdings in the last four months. Arkham noted that the 28,988 BTC ($3.4 billion) disclosed by the USMS represents only a fraction of the government''s total assets. ‚ÄúDid the US Government Sell 170,000 BTC ($20 Billion)? No. The US Marshals Service (USMS) states in a Freedom of Information Request response that they hold 28,988 BTC ($3.4 billion). However, other branches of the US Government, including the FBI, DOJ, DEA, and US Attorneys'' Offices, also seize and hold Bitcoin. The US Government currently holds at least 198,000 BTC ($23.5 billion) across multiple addresses held by different government entities; none of which have moved in 4 months. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Arkham Answers the Question Everyone''s Wondering: "Did the US Government Secretly Sell Bitcoin?" ‚Äì Reveals How Much BTC the US Holds!

HEADLINE: Poland admits one in five of Poles have invested in crypto during Bitcoin bill debate
SUMMARY: Some 18% of Polish citizens have already put money into crypto assets, according to Warsaw‚Äôs own estimates made public during a parliamentary debate on Poland‚Äôs upcoming cryptocurrency regulations. Members of the Sejm, the lower house of parliament in Poland, are considering a government-sponsored piece of legislation meant to regulate cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin in the country and the economy built around the digital assets. Bill No. 1424 was filed on June 26 and submitted for first reading in the chamber on July 7, the Polish crypto news outlet Bitcoin.pl reported Wednesday. On July 22, deputies launched the long-awaited debate on the proposed regulations, joined by representatives of the executive power in Warsaw. Fifth of Poles already invested in cryptocurrencies, government says Addressing lawmakers from the ruling majority and the opposition, Deputy Finance Minister Jurand Drop defended the cabinet‚Äôs motion, stressing that the Central European nation is yet to adopt rules providing protection for crypto investors. ‚Äú20% of investors in this market declare that they have fallen victim to some kind of fraud or abuse,‚Äù the government official pointed out, while also emphasizing: ‚ÄúIn Poland, 18% of people already have experience investing in crypto assets. These regulations are crucial for strengthening investor and customer protection in the crypto asset market.‚Äù Polish crypto sector fears bill may spark exodus of businesses The new legislation, aimed at transposing the European Union‚Äôs Markets in Crypto Assets ( MiCA ) regulation into national law, has been the cause of deep concerns among the members of the local crypto community. A worrying move for them is the decision to entrust oversight to the Polish Financial Supervision Authority ( KNF ), ‚Äúwhich is notorious for its less-than-favorable attitude toward cryptocurrencies,‚Äù as Bitcoin.pl remarked in its article. Another controversial moment has been the proposal to impose a 0.5% fee on the revenues of Polish crypto exchanges, which is not required by MiCA, while charging foreign-based trading platforms only a one-time fee of around $5,000. Representatives of Poland‚Äôs crypto industry have complained that this would hurt their ability to compete with exchanges based abroad. It may even push Polish companies to relocate to more favorable jurisdictions in order to continue to work in their own market. Lawmakers from the opposition highlighted these and other issues with the bill. Janusz Kowalski, from the right-wing conservative Law and Justice (PiS) party suggested such charges should be capped and criticized the idea to grant supervisory powers to the KNF. ‚ÄúPoland has enormous potential in the crypto asset innovation sector. But instead of harnessing it, the Ministry of Finance wants to stifle the development of crypto assets, which is a dramatic reversal of global trends,‚Äù Kowalski stated in a post on X, following the parliamentary session. üîπPolska ma ogromny potencja≈Ç w sektorze innowacji kryptoaktyw√≥w. Ale zamiast go wykorzystaƒá, @MF_GOV_PL chce zablokowaƒá rozw√≥j kryptoaktyw√≥w, co jest dramatycznym odwr√≥ceniem ≈õwiatowych trend√≥w. üîπChcemy jako @pisorgpl , aby polscy informatycy pracowali dla polskich firm, w‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/ZRTTbMuAW5 ‚Äî Janusz Kowalski üáµüá± (@JKowalski_posel) July 22, 2025 ‚ÄúAs PiS, we want Polish IT specialists to work for Polish companies, in Poland‚Äînot in the Czech Republic, Malta, or Germany‚Äîand for Poland to be the number one investment destination for crypto asset investments,‚Äù he insisted, further reasoning: ‚ÄúTherefore, we need simple and sensible regulations regarding crypto assets, not the overregulated law proposed by [Prime Minister] Donald Tusk‚Äôs government.‚Äù Speaking to the leading Polish daily Gazeta Wyborcza, Kowalski recently announced that if the Sejm does not amend the document, PiS-backed President-elect Karol Nawrocki, who is assuming office in early August, will veto the legislation. ‚ÄúThe government‚Äôs draft bill fails to meet the fundamental principle that should apply when implementing EU law: ‚ÄòEU+zero‚Äô,‚Äù he stated, rejecting rules added by Polish politicians. The latter ‚Äúwould block the development of crypto assets in Poland for years,‚Äù Kowalski warned. Your crypto news deserves attention - KEY Difference Wire puts you on 250+ top sites

HEADLINE: Crypto groups plead for Trump to stop JPMorgan''s scheme to tax payment data
SUMMARY: Cryptocurrency and financial technology industry groups are calling on President Donald Trump to intervene in the ‚Äúcoordinated attempt‚Äù by big banks, led by JPMorgan Chase, to undermine open banking regulations by imposing fees for accessing customer financial data. The plea was outlined in a letter sent on Wednesday to the White House, signed by ten major trade associations representing fintech and digital asset firms, including the Blockchain Association and the Crypto Council for Innovation. These groups claim JPMorgan‚Äôs decision to charge third-party fintechs for access to customer account data is a ‚Äúthreat to innovation‚Äù and will harm the ecosystem of crypto and digital payments in the United States. JPMorgan to charge for data access Last month, JPMorgan Chase informed third-party data aggregators like Plaid and MX that it will begin charging fees when they access customer banking information. These aggregators provide the data infrastructure to many fintech and crypto services, including moving funds between JPMorgan accounts and platforms like Robinhood or self-custody wallets used for digital assets such as USDC or USDT. Until now, access to this data has generally been free. But under the proposed changes, the bank could charge fees every time an aggregator pulls a customer‚Äôs data. These costs are expected to be passed downstream, first to fintech platforms and eventually to end users. One founder told the press that the cost of accessing JPMorgan‚Äôs APIs would exceed the company‚Äôs total revenue since its founding over a decade ago. Another industry executive said the new charges would effectively ‚Äúput everyone out of business‚Äù unless they raise prices by up to 1,000%. ‚Äú The JPMorgan fees make it impossible to serve Chase customers if you are a small company, ‚Äù the fintech executive warned. Letter to the White House explains consumer risks The coalition‚Äôs letter from the ten companies argues that JPMorgan‚Äôs plan could ‚Äúde-bank‚Äù millions of Americans and deny them access to core financial services in crypto , especially for stablecoins. It could nerf the use of self-custody wallets and real-time digital payments, the groups said. ‚Äú Let us be clear: financial data belongs to the American people, not the banks ,‚Äù the letter read. ‚Äú By challenging open banking, the largest banks stand in direct opposition to your vision of making America the financial innovation capital of the world. ‚Äù The trade groups are urging the Trump administration to take immediate action before July 29, when it is expected to submit a legal brief in an ongoing federal case over the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau‚Äôs (CFPB) new open banking rules, specifically Rule 1033 . The regulation, finalized by the CFPB in late 2024, requires financial institutions to provide consumers with free access to their account data and allows them to share it with third-party providers. Still, financial institutions banks like JPMorgan immediately filed lawsuits to block the rule on the same day it was finalized. The CFPB gave in to legal pressure from the banking industry and asked the courts to vacate the rule. According to industry estimates, if JPMorgan‚Äôs plan proceeds, Plaid alone could be forced to pay up to $300 million annually in fees, more than 75% of its current revenue. Kraken co-CEO Arjun Sethi, in a July 12 article written on social platform X, called JPMorgan‚Äôs decision to charge fees for data part of a ‚Äúcalculated shift‚Äù where banks are monetizing user-generated data and erecting tolls around personal information. ‚Äú There is a version of the future where every financial interaction is intermediated by systems that monitor, price, and gate access to your own data, ‚Äù Sethi wrote. ‚Äú Crypto presents an alternative. But that alternative is not guaranteed. ‚Äù Your crypto news deserves attention - KEY Difference Wire puts you on 250+ top sites

HEADLINE: Bitcoin Breakdown? BTC Price Analysis Warns of Sharp Drop Below $111K
SUMMARY: Bitcoin‚Äôs consolidation has been extended, with the price hovering around the $120K price range. A break below the $116K support is expected, likely pushing the price down toward the $111K region. Technical Analysis By ShayanMarkets The Daily Chart Bitcoin‚Äôs price consolidation continues just below its all-time high of $123K, hovering between the $116K and $120K levels. This price behavior signals an equilibrium zone, where buying and selling pressure are currently balanced, a sign that the market awaits a fresh catalyst. Importantly, this range also aligns with the 0.5-0.618 levels of the Trend-Based Fibonacci Extension, adding further technical significance to the current resistance zone. Given the lack of strong bullish momentum, a deeper correction below $116K is likely, with the $111K zone emerging as the next key target. The 4-Hour Chart On the lower timeframe, BTC appears to be forming a bullish flag ‚Äî a classic continuation pattern. Despite multiple rebounds from the $116K support, repeated testing suggests growing vulnerability. These reactions have likely created a sell-side liquidity pool just below $116K, increasing the probability of a liquidity sweep followed by a bearish breakout. Should this support level fail, the asset could swiftly decline toward the flag‚Äôs lower boundary near $111K. On-chain Analysis By ShayanMarkets The Binance BTC/USDT Liquidation Heatmap reveals a critical tug-of-war in the current market structure. Bitcoin‚Äôs price is currently trapped between two major liquidity clusters, with significant liquidation pools above $120K and below $116K. These zones represent a high concentration of leveraged futures positions, making them prime targets for smart money and market makers seeking liquidity. A price move toward either level could trigger a cascade of liquidations, intensifying volatility and rapidly accelerating price action. As a result, Bitcoin remains range-bound between these two zones until one side is taken out. A breakout above $120K or a breakdown below $116K will likely lead to a sharp, directional move, fueled by stop-losses and forced liquidations. Traders should keep a close eye on these levels and prepare for potential whipsaw volatility once either threshold is breached. The post Bitcoin Breakdown? BTC Price Analysis Warns of Sharp Drop Below $111K appeared first on CryptoPotato .

HEADLINE: Ethereum Outperformance: Unveiling Why ETH Could Eclipse Bitcoin in Coming Months
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Ethereum Outperformance: Unveiling Why ETH Could Eclipse Bitcoin in Coming Months The world of digital assets constantly buzzes with predictions, but when a figure like Michael Novogratz speaks, the crypto community listens. The CEO of Galaxy Digital recently made a bold declaration that has sent ripples across the market: he believes Ethereum (ETH) could potentially achieve significant Ethereum outperformance against Bitcoin (BTC) over the next three to six months. This isn‚Äôt just a casual remark; it‚Äôs a statement from a seasoned investor with deep insights into the evolving landscape of cryptocurrencies. But what exactly underpins this intriguing forecast, and what could it mean for the future trajectory of these two crypto titans? Why is Michael Novogratz Bullish on Ethereum Outperformance? Michael Novogratz‚Äôs conviction stems from a nuanced understanding of Ethereum‚Äôs intrinsic value proposition and its ongoing developmental milestones. While Bitcoin is widely revered as ‚Äòdigital gold‚Äô ‚Äì a robust store of value and a hedge against inflation ‚Äì Ethereum is increasingly seen as the foundational layer for the decentralized internet. Novogratz highlighted that Ethereum‚Äôs utility, driven by its vast ecosystem of decentralized applications (dApps), non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols, positions it for unique growth. He argues that as the digital economy matures, the demand for a programmable blockchain that supports innovation will naturally lead to its appreciation. The continuous evolution of the Ethereum network, particularly its transition to a Proof-of-Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, is a significant factor in his optimistic outlook. This pivotal shift, aimed at improving scalability, security, and energy efficiency, is expected to make Ethereum even more attractive to developers and users alike. Novogratz essentially posits that while Bitcoin holds its ground as a macroeconomic asset, Ethereum is poised to capture the lion‚Äôs share of growth in the burgeoning Web3 space, thereby fueling its potential for substantial Ethereum outperformance . What Factors Drive Potential Ethereum Outperformance? The prospect of Ethereum outperformance isn‚Äôt merely a speculative forecast; it‚Äôs rooted in several tangible developments and inherent strengths of the Ethereum network. Understanding these drivers is crucial for anyone looking to grasp the dynamics of the crypto market. The Ethereum 2.0 Transition (The Merge and Beyond): The successful completion of ‚ÄòThe Merge‚Äô marked Ethereum‚Äôs shift from Proof-of-Work (PoW) to Proof-of-Stake (PoS). This transition drastically reduced Ethereum‚Äôs energy consumption, making it a more environmentally friendly blockchain. Future upgrades, such as the ‚ÄòShanghai‚Äô upgrade enabling staked ETH withdrawals, further enhance the network‚Äôs appeal by improving liquidity for stakers. The long-term roadmap includes sharding, which aims to significantly boost transaction throughput and scalability. Staking Yields and Deflationary Pressure: With PoS, users can stake their ETH to secure the network and earn rewards. This creates a yield-bearing asset, attracting institutional and retail investors seeking passive income. Furthermore, a portion of transaction fees is ‚Äòburned‚Äô (removed from circulation), which can lead to a deflationary supply of ETH under certain network conditions, potentially increasing its scarcity and value. Dominance in DeFi and NFTs: Ethereum remains the undisputed leader in the DeFi and NFT sectors. The vast majority of decentralized applications, lending protocols, decentralized exchanges, and NFT marketplaces are built on Ethereum. As these sectors continue to grow and attract new users, the demand for ETH, which is used for gas fees and collateral, naturally increases. Layer 2 Scaling Solutions: While Ethereum‚Äôs mainnet can face congestion and high gas fees, its robust ecosystem includes a thriving landscape of Layer 2 (L2) scaling solutions like Arbitrum, Optimism, zkSync, and Polygon. These L2s process transactions off-chain, bundle them, and then settle them on the main Ethereum blockchain, effectively increasing throughput and reducing costs without compromising security. This symbiotic relationship ensures Ethereum‚Äôs continued relevance and scalability. Growing Institutional Interest: Institutional investors are increasingly looking beyond Bitcoin. The programmatic capabilities of Ethereum, its ESG-friendly PoS transition, and its role as the backbone of the decentralized economy are making it an attractive asset for large-scale investments. Products like ETH ETFs and institutional staking services are emerging, signaling growing mainstream acceptance. To put it into perspective, here‚Äôs a brief comparison of how Bitcoin and Ethereum fundamentally differ: Feature Bitcoin (BTC) Ethereum (ETH) Primary Use Case Store of Value, Digital Gold Programmable Blockchain, Smart Contract Platform Consensus Mechanism Proof-of-Work (Po

HEADLINE: Quantum Solutions, Listed on the Japanese Stock Exchange, Announces It Will Buy Large Amounts of Bitcoin! Here Are the Details
SUMMARY: Quantum Solutions, a developer of artificial intelligence solutions and listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange''s Standard Market, announced today that it aims to purchase a maximum of 3,000 Bitcoins within the next 12 months. This move marks the company''s official entry into the cryptocurrency investment business. Japanese Stock Exchange-Listed Quantum Solutions Enters Crypto Sector with ¬•500 Billion Bitcoin Investment Quantum Solutions stated that the investment decision was driven by factors such as the growing global acceptance of Bitcoin as digital gold, the growth of the cryptocurrency market, and the increased interest of institutional investors during times of economic uncertainty. In addition, the depreciation of the Japanese yen and the increase in global financial risks also influenced the company to take this step to protect against foreign exchange risk and inflation. The company also cited other pioneering firms in Japan that have incorporated Bitcoin into their balance sheets. For example, Metaplanet is currently the country''s largest institutional Bitcoin investor with 16,352 BTC. Remixpoint''s 1,051 BTC holdings and ANAP Holdings and Mac House''s 1,000 BTC targets are also noteworthy. Quantum Solutions'' 3,000 BTC target surpasses the majority of existing investors. If achieved, the company would become the second-largest Bitcoin holding among publicly traded companies in Japan. This step is seen as a new indicator of increasing institutional interest in Bitcoin from Japanese companies. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Quantum Solutions, Listed on the Japanese Stock Exchange, Announces It Will Buy Large Amounts of Bitcoin! Here Are the Details

HEADLINE: ECB Interest Rates: A Pivotal Pause in Monetary Policy
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld ECB Interest Rates: A Pivotal Pause in Monetary Policy In the dynamic world of finance, where every central bank decision sends ripples across global markets, the recent announcement from the European Central Bank (ECB) has certainly captured attention. For cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investors, understanding these macro shifts is paramount. The ECB‚Äôs decision to keep ECB interest rates unchanged marks a significant pause after a series of aggressive adjustments, prompting crucial questions about the Eurozone‚Äôs economic trajectory and its potential influence on digital assets. What Did the European Central Bank Decide on Interest Rates? According to JinSe Finance, the European Central Bank (ECB) has decided to maintain its key interest rates at their current levels. This move follows an unprecedented period of seven consecutive rate cuts, signaling a shift in the central bank‚Äôs monetary policy stance. Specifically, the deposit rate, which is the interest rate banks receive for depositing money with the ECB overnight, remains steady at 2%. This rate is a benchmark for lending and borrowing within the Eurozone‚Äôs financial system. Beyond the deposit rate, the ECB also confirmed that its other primary rates would remain unchanged: Main Refinancing Rate: This rate, at which commercial banks can borrow money from the ECB for one week, stays at 2.15%. It‚Äôs a key indicator of the cost of money in the economy. Marginal Lending Rate: The rate at which banks can borrow from the ECB overnight against eligible collateral remains at 2.40%. This serves as an upper bound for the overnight market interest rate. This collective decision to hold ECB interest rates steady reflects a period of assessment for the central bank, as it navigates complex economic data and geopolitical uncertainties. The stability in these rates suggests the ECB believes its previous actions have had the desired effect, or that new data points warrant a period of observation before further adjustments. Why Did the ECB Pause on Interest Rate Adjustments? The decision by the ECB to halt its aggressive cycle of rate cuts and keep ECB interest rates stable is a complex one, likely influenced by a confluence of economic indicators and strategic considerations. After seven consecutive cuts aimed at stimulating economic growth and combating deflationary pressures, the central bank is now in a different phase. Several factors could explain this pivotal pause: Inflationary Pressures: While overall inflation might have decreased, certain components, particularly core inflation (excluding volatile food and energy prices), might still be stubbornly high or showing signs of persistence. The ECB needs to ensure that inflation is firmly on track to meet its target of below, but close to, 2% over the medium term. Economic Data Evaluation: The ECB likely needs more time to fully assess the impact of its previous rate cuts on the Eurozone economy. Lag effects mean that monetary policy changes don‚Äôt immediately manifest in economic activity. Waiting allows for a clearer picture of GDP growth, employment figures, and consumer spending. Global Economic Headwinds: Uncertainties in the global economy, including supply chain disruptions, geopolitical tensions, and the performance of major trading partners, could also play a role. A pause allows the ECB to observe how these external factors evolve before committing to a new policy direction for ECB interest rates . Financial Stability Concerns: Rapid and continuous rate cuts, while stimulating, can also introduce risks to financial stability, such as asset bubbles or excessive risk-taking by banks. A pause can help mitigate these potential downsides and ensure a more stable financial environment. This period of stability in ECB interest rates can be seen as a strategic breath, allowing policymakers to gather more comprehensive data and recalibrate their approach for future decisions. How Do Unchanged ECB Interest Rates Impact the Eurozone Economy? The decision to keep ECB interest rates unchanged has multifaceted implications for the Eurozone economy, affecting everything from borrowing costs for consumers and businesses to the overall economic outlook. Understanding these impacts is key to grasping the broader financial landscape. Here‚Äôs how stable ECB interest rates might play out: Borrowing Costs: For consumers, unchanged rates mean that the cost of mortgages, car loans, and personal loans will likely remain stable. This provides a degree of predictability for household budgets, neither encouraging a spending spree through cheaper credit nor tightening belts due to rising costs. Businesses will also find borrowing costs for investment and expansion remain consistent, which can support ongoing projects but might not spur new, significant ventures if economic uncertainty persists. Inflation Trajectory: By not cutting rates further, the ECB signals its vigilance against inflation. While past cuts aimed to sti

HEADLINE: Semler Scientific‚Äôs Strategic Bitcoin Move: A Bold Step Towards Digital Asset Dominance
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Semler Scientific‚Äôs Strategic Bitcoin Move: A Bold Step Towards Digital Asset Dominance Semler Scientific Bitcoin : The financial world is abuzz once again as Nasdaq-listed Semler Scientific, a prominent medical technology company, makes headlines with its latest strategic move into the digital asset space. This isn‚Äôt just another small purchase; it‚Äôs a significant bolstering of their existing cryptocurrency reserves, sending a clear signal about the increasing confidence traditional corporations are placing in Bitcoin. For anyone tracking the evolution of corporate treasuries and the mainstream adoption of digital assets, this development from Semler Scientific is nothing short of pivotal. Semler Scientific Bitcoin: What Just Happened? In a move that underscores its deepening commitment to digital assets, Semler Scientific announced the acquisition of an additional 175 BTC. This latest purchase brings their total Bitcoin holdings to a remarkable 5,021 BTC. This update, initially highlighted by the crypto community via @btcNLNico on X, quickly resonated across financial news outlets, reinforcing the narrative of Bitcoin‚Äôs growing appeal as a treasury reserve asset. But why is a medical technology company making such a significant bet on Bitcoin? Strategic Vision: Semler Scientific views Bitcoin as a compelling investment due to its characteristics as a store of value and an inflation hedge. Long-Term Growth: The company believes in Bitcoin‚Äôs potential for long-term capital appreciation, positioning it as a key component of their overall financial strategy. Balance Sheet Diversification: Adding Bitcoin helps diversify their corporate treasury beyond traditional assets, potentially offering protection against economic uncertainties. Why Are Companies Like Semler Scientific Bitcoin Enthusiasts? The decision by Semler Scientific to substantially increase its Semler Scientific Bitcoin holdings is part of a broader trend among publicly traded companies. This isn‚Äôt a speculative gamble for many; it‚Äôs a calculated financial strategy driven by several compelling factors: Inflation Hedge: In an era of quantitative easing and rising inflation concerns, Bitcoin‚Äôs capped supply of 21 million coins makes it an attractive alternative to fiat currencies, which can lose purchasing power over time. Digital Gold Narrative: Increasingly, Bitcoin is being seen as ‚Äúdigital gold‚Äù ‚Äì a scarce, decentralized asset that can serve as a reliable store of value, especially during times of economic volatility. Diversification of Corporate Treasuries: Traditional corporate treasuries often rely heavily on cash, short-term government bonds, and other low-yield assets. Bitcoin offers a way to diversify and potentially enhance returns in a low-interest-rate environment. Forward-Thinking Investment: Companies that embrace Bitcoin are often perceived as innovative and forward-thinking, which can appeal to a new generation of investors and customers. This proactive stance can also position them favorably for the evolving digital economy. Potential for Appreciation: Despite its volatility, Bitcoin has historically demonstrated significant long-term growth, making it an attractive asset for companies looking to grow their balance sheets. The Growing Trend of Semler Scientific Bitcoin Acquisitions: A Broader Look While Semler Scientific‚Äôs latest acquisition is noteworthy, they are certainly not alone in this journey. The pioneer in this space, MicroStrategy, led by Michael Saylor, has famously amassed over 226,314 BTC, setting a precedent for corporate Bitcoin adoption. Other notable companies, from Tesla to Block Inc. (formerly Square), have also added Bitcoin to their balance sheets, albeit with varying strategies and scales. This growing cohort of institutional investors signals a fundamental shift in how corporations view digital assets. It moves Bitcoin from the realm of niche speculative investment to a legitimate treasury asset. The decision by a medical technology company like Semler Scientific, which operates in a traditionally conservative sector, further legitimizes Bitcoin‚Äôs role in diverse corporate portfolios. Let‚Äôs consider a brief comparison of some major corporate Bitcoin holders: Company Primary Industry Approx. BTC Holdings Rationale (General) MicroStrategy Business Intelligence ~226,314 BTC Primary treasury reserve asset, inflation hedge Block Inc. Financial Services/Payments ~8,027 BTC Investment, ecosystem integration Tesla Automotive/Energy ~9,720 BTC Investment, payment acceptance (historically) Semler Scientific Medical Technology ~5,021 BTC Store of value, inflation hedge, long-term growth (Note: BTC holdings are approximate and subject to change based on ongoing purchases/sales.) What Does This Mean for the Future of Semler Scientific Bitcoin Strategy? Semler Scientific‚Äôs continued investment in Bitcoin suggests a long-term vision. It‚Äôs not just about holding an asset; it‚Äôs about integrating it into their fi

HEADLINE: Ethereum Is Becoming Crypto‚Äôs Reserve Asset: New Research
SUMMARY: A new research from analytics firm Artemis argues that Ether is undergoing the same reputational pivot Bitcoin experienced in the mid-2010s, but on fundamentally different terms. ‚ÄúEvaluating ETH purely through the lens of cash flows or protocol fees is a category error,‚Äù writes lead author Kevin Li. ‚ÄúIt is better understood as a scarce yet productive, programmable reserve asset whose value accrues through its role in securing, settling and powering an increasingly institutionalized on-chain economy.‚Äù Ethereum‚Äôs Path To Reserve Asset Status Li begins by tackling the long-running critique that Ethereum‚Äôs flexible monetary policy disqualifies it as a store of value. He models a worst-case scenario in which every ETH in existence is staked and issuance hits its theoretical ceiling. Even then, annual inflation tops out at roughly 1.52 percent in 2025 and decays to 0.89 percent by 2125‚Äîwell below the US dollar‚Äôs 6.36 percent average M2 expansion since 1998 and even beneath gold‚Äôs long-run annual supply growth. The paper argues that the combination of sublinear issuance and the EIP-1559 burn has already pushed net inflation near‚Äîor periodically below‚Äîzero, giving ETH a supply profile that ‚Äúrivals gold while retaining the programmability of software.‚Äù Macro conditions provide the backdrop for the thesis. Artemis notes that decades of monetary expansion have eroded trust in fiat and driven investors toward alternative stores of value. The US consumer-price index has averaged 2.53 percent a year since 1998, but the money supply has grown more than twice as fast, a gap the report claims ‚Äúmay account for a significant share of nominal equity-market gains.‚Äù Ethereum‚Äôs adaptive monetary policy, Li contends, offers a disciplined alternative without sacrificing the network‚Äôs ability to pay validators. Institutional adoption is the second pillar of the argument. Over the past 12 months JPMorgan, BlackRock and Robinhood have each chosen Ethereum rails‚Äîeither the base layer or an affiliated roll-up‚Äîfor tokenized deposits, money-market funds and equity trading prototypes. The report cites BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL fund and JPMorgan‚Äôs forthcoming JPMD deposit token as proof that blue-chip institutions are no longer experimenting on testnets but building products that will settle value at scale. ‚ÄúAs traditional finance migrates on-chain, the need to hold and stake ETH becomes structural rather than discretionary,‚Äù Li writes. That dynamic is visible in on-chain data. Artemis calculates that the supply of stablecoins and tokenized real-world assets on Ethereum reached a record $123 billion in June, while the amount of ETH locked in validators climbed to 35.5 million. The year-on-year correlation between the value of on-chain assets and staked ETH exceeds 88 percent across every major category the firm tracks, reinforcing the idea that demand for security and settlement drives demand for the native token. Regulation, long the wild card for any staking-based value proposition, has started to tilt in Ethereum‚Äôs favor. On May 29 the US Securities and Exchange Commission‚Äôs Division of Corporation Finance issued guidance stating that protocol-level staking, delegated staking and certain custodial staking arrangements do not in themselves constitute securities offerings. While the ruling left room for fact-specific enforcement, it cleared the way for spot-ETH ETF filers to include staking provisions in their S-1 amendments. Several prospective issuers have since done exactly that, promising investors both passive exposure to ETH and a share of consensus rewards. Competition For Bitcoin? The Artemis report also highlights an emerging ‚Äútreasury-asset wave‚Äù reminiscent of MicroStrategy‚Äôs Bitcoin strategy in 2020. Sharplink Gaming disclosed in late May that it would begin allocating corporate cash to Ether, a move followed by a cluster of smaller US and Asian public companies. Together they now hold more than 730,000 ETH, or roughly $2.6 billion at current prices. The accumulation has coincided with a period of ETH outperformance versus BTC‚Äîan unusual trend in the current cycle, which has otherwise been dominated by Bitcoin narratives such as halving supply shocks and prospective US reserve holdings. Critics who argue that Layer 2 networks cannibalize Ethereum‚Äôs fee base ‚Äúmiss the point,‚Äù Li says. By off-loading execution while anchoring settlement and data availability to the base layer, roll-ups expand Ethereum‚Äôs total addressable market without eroding its security budget. Li compares the arrangement to the Federal Reserve System: ‚ÄúRegional banks handle day-to-day traffic, but ultimate settlement rests with the central bank.‚Äù In that analogy ETH is the reserve asset that guarantees finality. The paper concedes that other high-throughput Layer 1s, particularly Solana, have siphoned off ‚Äúmeme-coin velocity‚Äù and micro-transaction volume. Solana processed more transactions than Ethereum in five of the past six quarters. Yet Li argues that the market

HEADLINE: Ethereum Reserves: Unveiling BitMine‚Äôs Stunning $2 Billion Crypto Hoard
SUMMARY: BitcoinWorld Ethereum Reserves: Unveiling BitMine‚Äôs Stunning $2 Billion Crypto Hoard The cryptocurrency world is constantly evolving, presenting new narratives and unexpected twists. Just when you thought you had a handle on the typical operations of a Bitcoin mining giant, a surprising announcement shifts the spotlight. BitMine Immersion Technologies, a prominent player in the Bitcoin (BTC) mining space, has revealed an astonishing development: their Ethereum reserves have surged past the monumental $2 billion mark. This isn‚Äôt just a headline; it‚Äôs a clear signal of strategic diversification and a testament to the growing institutional confidence in Ethereum‚Äôs ecosystem. For a company primarily known for its BTC operations, accumulating such a significant cache of ETH sparks immediate questions and profound implications for the broader crypto market. What are BitMine‚Äôs Ethereum Reserves and Why Do They Matter? On July 23, BitMine Immersion Technologies, a company listed on the New York Stock Exchange, confirmed via a PR Newswire press release that its holdings of Ethereum (ETH) had reached an impressive 566,776 ETH. At current market valuations, this translates to over $2 billion in Ethereum reserves . This revelation is particularly significant because BitMine is fundamentally a Bitcoin mining enterprise. Traditionally, Bitcoin miners convert their mined BTC into fiat or hold it as their primary treasury asset. BitMine‚Äôs substantial ETH accumulation represents a deviation from this norm, highlighting a proactive strategy to broaden its digital asset portfolio. Why does this matter so much? Consider these points: Scale of Investment: $2 billion is not a trivial sum. It signifies a major capital allocation, reflecting deep conviction in Ethereum‚Äôs long-term value proposition. Diversification Play: For a Bitcoin-centric company, holding a significant amount of ETH acts as a diversification strategy, potentially mitigating risks associated with sole reliance on Bitcoin‚Äôs price movements. Market Signal: This move sends a strong message to the institutional world and the broader crypto community about Ethereum‚Äôs increasing acceptance as a core digital asset, not just a speculative altcoin. To put the value into perspective, here‚Äôs a snapshot of the reported holdings: Asset Quantity (as of July 23) Approximate USD Value (at time of announcement) Ethereum (ETH) 566,776 ETH Over $2 Billion The Strategic Shift: Why is a Bitcoin Miner Accumulating Ethereum Reserves? This bold move by BitMine raises a crucial question: What drives a Bitcoin mining company to amass such substantial Ethereum reserves ? The answer likely lies in a multi-faceted strategic approach that extends beyond traditional mining operations. Here are some key motivations: Portfolio Diversification: Just like traditional investment portfolios, crypto portfolios benefit from diversification. While Bitcoin is often seen as ‚Äúdigital gold,‚Äù Ethereum powers a vast ecosystem of decentralized applications (dApps), DeFi, NFTs, and more. Holding ETH allows BitMine to gain exposure to different growth vectors within the crypto space. Yield Opportunities (Staking): With Ethereum‚Äôs transition to Proof-of-Stake (PoS) via the Merge, holding ETH opens up opportunities for staking rewards. Companies can stake their ETH to support the network and earn passive income, turning a static asset into a productive one. This could be a significant long-term revenue stream for BitMine. Hedging Against Volatility: While both BTC and ETH are volatile, their price movements are not always perfectly correlated. Holding both assets can act as a hedge, potentially smoothing out overall portfolio performance during market fluctuations. Belief in Ethereum‚Äôs Ecosystem: BitMine‚Äôs decision signals a strong belief in the long-term viability and growth potential of the Ethereum network and its associated Web3 economy. As more applications and services are built on Ethereum, the underlying asset‚Äôs value could appreciate significantly. Institutional Adoption Trend: We‚Äôve seen a growing trend of institutional players exploring Ethereum beyond just Bitcoin. BitMine might be positioning itself to be at the forefront of this shift, appealing to a broader range of institutional investors who are increasingly interested in the entire digital asset landscape. This strategic pivot isn‚Äôt unique to BitMine, though their scale is notable. Other companies and even some Bitcoin miners have begun to explore holding other digital assets, but BitMine‚Äôs public declaration and the sheer volume of their Ethereum reserves set a precedent. Benefits of Accumulating Substantial Ethereum Reserves for Companies Beyond the immediate financial figures, a company holding significant Ethereum reserves can unlock several strategic advantages. This move isn‚Äôt just about speculation; it‚Äôs about strengthening the balance sheet and positioning for future growth in the digital economy. Enhanced Balance Sheet Strength: A lar

HEADLINE: The Psychology Trap: Why Most Traders Miss the Biggest Moves as ETH/BTC Breaks Out
SUMMARY: ETH/BTC breaks out after months of consolidation, signaling a trend reversal. Many traders fall into a psychology trap, hesitating for the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù entry and missing key opportunities. Momentum may pause briefly, but technical indicators suggest stronger gains ahead for Ethereum and altcoins. Most traders fall into a psychological trap that causes them to miss major moves, but the recent ETH/BTC breakout signals a warning to act now. According to a chart shared by ‚ÄúOur Crypto Talk,‚Äù Ethereum has broken out against Bitcoin after a months-long consolidation. This has raised the possibility that a new altseason is beginning. The analysis warns that traders watching from the sidelines risk missing the next biggest move in crypto. ETH/BTC Breakout Marks Technical Turning Point Notably, the ETH/BTC ratio broke above a consolidation range this week. After bottoming near 0.01800 in April, Ethereum steadily climbed and recently broke out of a long-held consolidation zone between 0.02400 and 0.02600 in what analysts describe as an accumulation phase. Now, Ethereum appears to be gaining momentum, outperforming Bitcoin as it reclaims key resistance leve‚Ä¶ The post The Psychology Trap: Why Most Traders Miss the Biggest Moves as ETH/BTC Breaks Out appeared first on Coin Edition .

So far, it has gone halfway, raising over $14 million, and the price of the $XYZ token currently stands at $0.003333 . Following the presale, $XYZ will be listed on major centralized and decentralized exchanges. The team has not disclosed the details yet, but they have put a teaser for a big launch. Born for Fighters, Built for Champions XYZVerse is building a community for those hungry for big profits in crypto ‚Äî the relentless, the ambitious, the ones aiming for dominance. This is a coin for true fighters ‚Äî a mindset that resonates with athletes and sports fans alike. $XYZ is the token for thrill-seekers chasing the next big meme coin. Since 2014, it has processed billions of transactions and partnered with big companies. Stellar allows transfers of any currency, including digital versions of dollars or cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin. Instead of replacing banks, it connects them on one network, aiming to improve the current financial system. Stellar‚Äôs technology enables quick, low-cost transfers worldwide. This is attractive for people sending money abroad and for businesses needing fast payments. In today‚Äôs market, with growing interest in blockchain, Stellar shines due to its real-world use cases. By enhancing existing financial systems rather than competing with them, Stellar may have an advantage over other cryptocurrencies. As digital money becomes more common, Stellar could play a key role in global transactions. TRON (TRX): Empowering Creators in a Decentralized World TRON (TRX) is a blockchain platform launched by the Tron Foundation in 2017. It began as tokens on the Ethereum network but moved to its own system a year later. TRON‚Äôs main goal is to give full ownership rights to digital content creators. By cutting out middlemen like YouTube or Facebook, it allows consumers to reward creators directly. This means artists and developers can earn more from their work without large companies taking a big cut. The platform supports smart contracts and decentralized apps, often called dApps. Anyone can build on TRON‚Äôs network, share content, and receive digital assets in return. With low transaction fees, creators can share their work freely and openly. In today‚Äôs market, TRON stands out as an alternative to platforms like Ethereum. While some networks face high fees and slow transactions, TRON offers speed and efficiency. As the demand for decentralized solutions grows, TRON‚Äôs focus on empowering creators makes it a noteworthy player in the blockchain space. LUNA Classic (LUNC): A Classic Comeback in the Crypto World Terra is a blockchain platform that aims to make global payments stable and fast. It uses coins tied to real-world currencies like the U.S. dollar and the South Korean won. By combining the stability of traditional money with the openness of Bitcoin, Terra offers quick and affordable transactions without censorship. In May 2022, Terra launched a new chain called Terra (LUNA), and the original chain was renamed Terra Classic with its token now known as LUNA Classic (LUNC). Now, LUNC is capturing attention as it seeks to regain its place in the crypto market. Some see it as a chance for Terra to rebuild trust and innovate once more. With the ever-changing crypto landscape, LUNC could offer opportunities for those looking for potential gr

HEADLINE: Solana Core Developers Present a New Proposal to Increase Network Transaction Capacity! Here Are the Details
SUMMARY: Solana core developers have published a new development proposal, SIMD-0286, with the aim of increasing the processing capacity of the network. Solana Developers Plan to Increase Block Computation Limit by 66% to Increase Network Capacity This proposal aims to increase the compute unit limit that can be processed every 400 millisecond blocks on the Solana blockchain from 60 million CUs to 100 million CUs, representing a 66% capacity increase. According to the proposal published on the Solana Foundation''s GitHub page, this update aims to increase the network''s throughput by enabling higher transaction volume, particularly for decentralized finance (DeFi) users and developers. Block limits define the maximum computational load that validators can process within each block. Increasing this limit will allow applications that require high computational power, particularly orderbook-based decentralized exchanges (DEXs) and Maximum Extractable Value (MEV) auctions, to operate without encountering ‚Äúcomputation budget exceeded‚Äù errors. However, this will also require more robust processing capacity from validators. The Solana network increased its block limit to 60 million CUs with SIMD-0256 on July 23rd. This change allowed the network to process approximately 1,700 transactions per second during daylight hours. However, with the rise of applications like re-staking protocols, NFT minting, and DePIN projects operating on the network, developers began demanding more block space. The SIMD-0286 proposal is currently being discussed and tested within the community. The update is expected to be deployed with a future software release and automatically activate in a future epoch once a majority of network validators have accepted the upgrade. This development comes at a time when rival blockchains are rolling out their own upgrades. Ethereum, with its Pectra hardfork, has enhanced its use of ephemeral data blobs for rollups, introduced in the Dencun update. The Bitcoin community is working on a new opcode called OP_CAT, which could improve smart contract capabilities and scripting, paving the way for more programmable transactions on the network. This block capacity increase proposed by Solana is considered a critical step in the intensely competitive blockchain infrastructure development race. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Solana Core Developers Present a New Proposal to Increase Network Transaction Capacity! Here Are the Details

HEADLINE: SEC decision expected by October as Fidelity pushes for in-kind BTC ETF redemptions
SUMMARY: Fidelity has filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to enable in-kind redemption for FBTC, its spot Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). Bloomberg Intelligence ETF research analyst James Seyffart confirmed the application on X. Seyffart‚Äôs confirmation came as a rebuttal to the rumors circulating that FBTC now allows in-kind redemption. According to the commentator, the SEC has not allowed this yet, even though the regulator is expected to allow it eventually. He said : ‚ÄúSeeing a lot of accounts reporting that Fidelity is now able to do in-kind creation/redemption with their Bitcoin ETF. The SEC hasn‚Äôt yet allowed this‚Ä¶ We do expect the SEC to approve this. But they haven‚Äôt yet.‚Äù Beyond Fidelity , several other issuers have filed amendments to enable this type of redemption for their spot crypto ETF products. These include Ark 21Shares, Galaxy, WisdomTree, VanEck, and Invesco Galaxy. Interestingly, it is not just Bitcoin ETFs trying to amend for in-kind redemptions. ETH spot ETFs are also filing for amendments, and the CBOE exchange recently filed for five ETFs listed on it. If approved, in-kind redemption would allow authorized participants to create and redeem the crypto ETF shares directly in Bitcoin instead of first converting the digital assets to cash. Commentators such as Seyffart say this will improve efficiency for spot and futures crypto ETFs and allow them to trade similarly to traditional ETFs. It is also expected to reduce costs by helping participants avoid taxes associated with transactions. Although the change, if approved, will only affect institutional participants in those ETFs rather than the retail traders, the idea of in-kind redemption remains something the crypto community is watching out for. This is likely why rumors of approval for FBTC quickly circulated on X. Fidelity‚Äôs in-kind redemption approval is likely to come in October While rumors of approvals have been debunked, Seyffart noted that it is likely to come by October. According to him, this is because the first official deadline for the SEC to decide on the pending in-kind amendments is around October 10. He said: ‚ÄúOfficial deadline for any sort of In-kind create/redeem is in October (~Oct 10). Our base case is that they will all be approved by October.‚Äù However, he acknowledged that the recent filing of amendments by the CBOE is a positive sign because it shows that work is going on at the SEC to finalize this decision, with firms also fine-tuning their applications. Interestingly, this is not the only crypto ETF decision before the SEC. The regulator also has a decision to make on the hundreds of spot crypto ETFs applications before it, and has yet to lift the stay orders on the two multi-assets funds approved for their conversion to ETFs. Bitcoin ETFs see three days of outflows Meanwhile, Bitcoin ETFs have now seen three days of consecutive outflows this week in what appears to be a continuation of sell-offs happening to the underlying asset since it reached the peak above $123,000. According to data from Farside Investors , the products have seen a combined outflow of $285.2 million in those three days, with Ark 21Shares ARKB responsible for most of the outflows. Interestingly, BlackRock IBIT has seen no outflow during this time; instead, it had two days of zero flows and recorded $142.6 million in inflows on Wednesday. Despite the broader outflows for spot Bitcoin ETFs, analysts believe institutional investors remain behind the rally. CryptoQuant verified analyst Burak Kesmeci noted that on-chain data and Google Trends show that accumulation has been from big players while retail has been selling since early 2023. Bitcoin‚Äôs larger investors are driving price rally as retail holdings decline. Source: CryptoQuant He said: ‚ÄúSearches for ‚ÄòBitcoin‚Äô are not at their lowest in the past 5 years, but they are still quite muted. So there is no retail FOMO or hype at this point. The crowd has not awakened yet. This cycle looks nothing like the madness of 2021.‚Äù With retail yet to get involved and BTC already scaling multiple peaks, Kesmeci believes that Bitcoin might still have more room to go up. However, he noted that retail entry could mark a market top. KEY Difference Wire : the secret tool crypto projects use to get guaranteed media coverage
text: SEC decision expected by October as Fidelity pushes for in-kind BTC ETF redemptions. Fidelity has filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to enable in-kind redemption for FBTC, its spot Bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF). Bloomberg Intelligence ETF research analyst James Seyffart confirmed the application on X. Seyffart‚Äôs confirmation came as a rebuttal to the rumors circulating that FBTC now allows in-kind redemption. According to the commentator, the SEC has not allowed this yet, even though the regulator is expected to allow it eventually. He said : ‚ÄúSeeing a lot of accounts reporting that Fidelity is now able to do in-kind creation/redemption with their Bitcoin ETF. The SEC hasn‚Äôt yet allowed this‚Ä¶ We do expect the SEC to approve this. But they haven‚Äôt yet.‚Äù Beyond Fidelity , several other issuers have filed amendments to enable this type of redemption for their spot crypto ETF products. These include Ark 21Shares, Galaxy, WisdomTree, VanEck, and Invesco Galaxy. Interestingly, it is not just Bitcoin ETFs trying to amend for in-kind redemptions. ETH spot ETFs are also filing for amendments, and the CBOE exchange recently filed for five ETFs listed on it. If approved, in-kind redemption would allow authorized participants to create and redeem the crypto ETF shares directly in Bitcoin instead of first converting the digital assets to cash. Commentators such as Seyffart say this will improve efficiency for spot and futures crypto ETFs and allow them to trade similarly to traditional ETFs. It is also expected to reduce costs by helping participants avoid taxes associated with transactions. Although the change, if approved, will only affect institutional participants in those ETFs rather than the retail traders, the idea of in-kind redemption remains something the crypto community is watching out for. This is likely why rumors of approval for FBTC quickly circulated on X.
